results.title: Swimming pool
results.creator_credit: Francois Ozon, Marc Missonnier, Olivier Delbosc, Fidelite Productions, Foz, France2 Cinema and Gimages Films
results.brief_description: In his first film in English, writer/director Francois Ozon directs two actors that have worked with him before - Charlotte Rampling (“Under The Sand”) and Ludivine Sagnier (“8 Women”). Enlisting performances that essentially carry the narrative, Ozon’s preference for films dealing with psychological manipulation is evident with this film. Sarah Morton (Rampling) is an English crime writer who jaded by her monetary success and fame seeks out her publisher John Bosload (Charles Dance) and a morning whiskey to help cheer her up. He suggests she uses his holiday house in France for a break and possibly some inspiration for her next novel in a detective series she has been writing. Her time in France seems to be just what she needs, until a visit by Bosload’s estranged daughter Julie (Sagnier) throws her staid and orderly self into disarray. Sexually provocative and physically beautiful, Julie becomes her new fascination and the two women form a bond when murder and muse become intertwined in their summer idyll by the swimming pool. Charlotte Rampling was winner of Best Actress from the European Film Academy in 2003 for her role of Morton. Official selection Cannes 2003. Cast includes Marc Fayolle and Jean-Marie Lamour.

results.title: Secretary
results.creator_credit: Steven Shainberg, Amy Hobby, Andrew Fierberg, Double A Films and Lions Gate Films
results.brief_description: A secretarial role at a law firm is a first job for a young girl with expert typing skills and having just left a hostel for people with mental illness, the girl also has a troubled home life and a history of self-mutilation. A look at contemporary sexual politics where ‘coming out’ has new meaning. The secretary, Lee Holloway (Maggie Gyllenhaal), reveals to her family and friends the need for her masochistic relationship with her boss E. Edward Grey (James Spader) and their special kind of love. The kind of office politics this film contains would horrify any Human Resources department! Based on the story “Secretary” by Mary Gaitskill. Cast includes Jeremy Davies. Contains Sex Scenes.

results.title: Adaptation
results.creator_credit: Spike Jonze, Edward Saxon, Jonathan Demme, Vincent Landay, Columbia and Intermedia
results.brief_description: From the creators of “Being John Malkovich” - director Spike Jonze and screenwriter Charlie Kaufman - comes the strangely twisted tale of woe of a screenwriter given the task of adapting a novel to the screen. In a desperate struggle, he actually writes himself (and his twin brother) into the story and reality and fiction start to blur, creating some dramatic and at times, comic situations. Cast includes Nicholas Cage, Meryl Streep and Chris Cooper (Academy Award Winner Best Supporting Actor for this role). Screenplay by Charlie and Donald Kaufman. “Adaptation” is also winner of two Golden Globe Awards. Based on the book “The Orchard Thief” by Susan Orlean.

results.title: The Stepford wives (1975) [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Bryan Forbes, Edgar J. Scherick, Fadsin Cinema Associates and Palomar Pictures International
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Ira Levin, the chilling and controversial story of “The Stepford wives” has become a cult classic with its cutting social commentary and chauvinistic/mysognystic themes. It is a tale of perfection, where perfect housewives dutifully serve their husbands and family in domestic bliss in their perfect homes in the sanitised but perfect suburb of Stepford. But something is horribly wrong. Why do all the Stepford men belong to the mysterious Stepford Men’s Club and why do all the women appear to look and behave in the same manner - vacant and robotic? Is there a strange conspiracy going on in the village of Stepford? This very 70s film features Katharine Ross, Paula Prentiss, Peter Masterson, Nanette Newman and Patick O’Neal with screenplay by William Goldman.

results.title: Angels in America
results.creator_credit: Mike Nichols, Celia Costas and Home Box Office
results.brief_description: Caustic, funny, politically charged award winning television series, with an all-star cast set in New York City of the mid-1980s, when the horrific effects of AIDS was beginning to be realised. The narrative centres around numerous gay men some infected, some not and how it effects their lives and those of their families. Contains several celestial scenes, as well imaginary humorous settings that allow characters to ruminate and reflect upon their fate. Angels make appearances, the dead are raised and visions of the afterlife abound in this inventive, poetic and insightful work. Cast includes: Meryl Streep, Al Pacino, Mary Louise Parker, Jeffrey Wright and Emma Thompson. Directed by Mike Nichols and written by Tony Kushner, based on his Pulitzer winning play.

results.title: The Fog of war
results.creator_credit: Errol Morris, Julie Bilson Ahlberg, Michael Williams, Radical Media and Search Films
results.brief_description: Outstanding documentary from iconic filmmaker Errol Morris about Robert S. McNamara, Secretary of Defence in the United States government during the Kennedy and early Johnson years, who oversaw US involvement in the Vietnam war. McNamara is a fascinating and worthy subject, not only for his wry and articulate tales but also for his amazing experiences, as a key figure in the US government in the 20th century, and as head of the World Bank for thirteen years. Morris inter-cuts the interviews with stunning archival footage, recorded White House conversations and with poetically rendered images that relay the poignancy, sadness and tragedy of war. Haunting score by Phillip Glass. Academy Award winner, Best Documentary Feautre, 2003.

results.title: Wonder boys
results.creator_credit: Curtis Hanson, Scott Rudin and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: From the director of “LA Confidential” and based on the novel by Michael Chabon, “Wonder Boys” directed by Curtis Hanson is a dry witted comedy about middle aged writing professor Grady Tripp (Michael Douglas) who is having trouble surpassing the success of his first novel with bad case of writer’s block. Things are not going well for him in life generally as a student (Tobey Maquire) is obsessed with him, his married lover is pregnant (Frances McDormand) and his wife has left him. Academy Award winner for Best Music, Song by Bob Dylan. Cast includes Robert Downey Jr, Katie Holmes and Rip Torn with screenplay by Steve Kloves.

results.title: Undead
results.creator_credit: Michael Spierig, Peter Spierig, Imagine Entertainment (US) and Spierigfilm
results.brief_description: Australian twin filmmaking brothers, Michael and Peter Spierig, have written, produced and directed this, their first feature film. They have achieved their goal of creating a schlock splatter horror with a load of laughs but with a sci-fi alien plot twist that makes it stands out. What also stands out is the finish of the film as its low budget is not that evident in the final outcome. Fictional small Australian country town of Berkeley, renowned for its good fishing, is invaded by aliens that send strange meteors from space turning people into the undead - zombies. The local beauty contest winner Rene (Felicity Mason) is about to leave town but is prevented when her driver becomes victim to zombie attack. The local town loony, a tall silent bloke called Marion (Mungo McKay), comes to her aid with a three-barrelled custom-made rifle. Blood, gore, splatter and laughs aplenty ensue as our hapless heroes (including the swearing town cop and his rookie constable, Wayne and his pregnant girlfriend) go about surviving the onslaught of brain sucking zombies. The aliens appear on earth cleansing some folks with healing rain and they are then ascended to orbit the earth. The ending has the potential for a sequel and hopefully someone will give them the money! This is must see cult classic for those into the schlock/horror or low budget independent genre/s. Crew that deserve special mention are the make-up designer Steven Boyle, cinematographer Andrew Strahorn, composer Cliff Bradley and everyone that worked on the special effects, which includes the directors. (“The Making Of” in the extras is worth a look if you’re thinking of making a low budget feature!) Hopefully there will be more from The Spierig Brothers in the future. SOME SCENES MAY DISTURB.

results.title: 21 grams = Twenty one grams
results.creator_credit: Alejandro Gonzalez Inarritu, Robert Salerno, Focus Features, This Is That and Y Production
results.brief_description: Following a tragic accident, three people’s lives are connected in a way that is emotionally intense and devastating. Christine (Naomi Watts) is a wife and mother of two girls. Paul (Sean Penn) is a mathematician with a congenital heart problem and a troubled relationship. Jack (Benicio Del Toro) is an ex-con, born-again Christian and father of two children. This revenge-style drama could be told in a straight forward way but the writer Guillermo Arriaga and director Alejandro Gonzalez Inarritu have chosen a non-linear approach with the story told by glimpses forward and back until becoming clear to the viewer just how these people’s lives do connect. The three leads are convincing in their performances with Watts and Del Toro being nominated for Academy Awards and Sean Penn for a BAFTA.
